articles.headline: Cuba’s New Luxury Hotels Look to Lure Waves of U.S. Tourists
articles.snippet: As Cuba’s relationship with the United States grows warmer, redevelopment is heating up, too. But obstacles lie between the pent-up demand and the potential payoff.
articles.abstract: As Cuba’s relationship with the United States grows warmer, redevelopment is heating up, too. But obstacles lie between the pent-up demand and the potential payoff.
articles.lead_paragraph: HAVANA — In Havana’s Parque Central, shady stone benches and graceful palm trees beckon to mojito-sipping tourists and locals gathering to shoot the breeze.

articles.headline: A Trump Dividend for Canada? Maybe in Its A.I. Industry
articles.snippet: Canada is becoming an increasingly appealing alternative to the United States for some technologists in hot fields like artificial intelligence.
articles.abstract: Canada is becoming an increasingly appealing alternative to the United States for some technologists in hot fields like artificial intelligence.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amir Moravej, an Iranian computer engineer in Montreal, quietly worked last year on building software to help people navigate the Canadian immigration system. He saw it as a way for others to avoid the same immigration travails he suffered a few years earlier.

articles.headline: Trump to Arm Syrian Kurds, Even as Turkey Strongly Objects
articles.snippet: American commanders have long argued for arming the Y.P.G., a Kurdish militia with some of the most experienced fighters in the battle against the Islamic State.
articles.abstract: American commanders have long argued for arming the Y.P.G., a Kurdish militia with some of the most experienced fighters in the battle against the Islamic State.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has approved a plan to arm Syrian Kurds so they can participate in the battle to retake Raqqa from the Islamic State, a strategy that has drawn deep opposition from Turkey, a NATO ally.
articles.byline: By Michael R. Gordon and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: F.B.I. Director James Comey Is Fired by Trump
articles.snippet: President Trump abruptly terminated Mr. Comey, who was leading an investigation into whether Mr. Trump’s advisers colluded with Russia to influence the election.
articles.abstract: President Trump abruptly terminated Mr. Comey, who was leading an investigation into whether Mr. Trump’s advisers colluded with Russia to influence the election.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Tuesday fired the director of the F.B.I., James B. Comey, abruptly terminating the top official leading a criminal investigation into whether Mr. Trump’s advisers colluded with the Russian government to steer the outcome of the 2016 presidential election.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Matt Apuzzo

articles.headline: In Trump’s Firing of James Comey, Echoes of Watergate
articles.snippet: Not since Watergate has a president dismissed the person leading an investigation bearing on him, and the dismissal drew instant comparisons to the Saturday Night Massacre.
articles.abstract: Not since Watergate has a president dismissed the person leading an investigation bearing on him, and the dismissal drew instant comparisons to the Saturday Night Massacre.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In dramatically casting aside James B. Comey, President Trump fired the man who may have helped make him president — and the man who potentially most threatened the future of his presidency.

articles.headline: Disney Parks and Movies Soar, but ESPN Is a Concern
articles.snippet: The Walt Disney Company reported better-than-expected earnings, but analysts peppered Robert A. Iger with questions about the health of ESPN.
articles.abstract: The Walt Disney Company reported better-than-expected earnings, but analysts peppered Robert A. Iger with questions about the health of ESPN.

articles.headline: Hackers Came, but the French Were Prepared
articles.snippet: Emmanuel Macron’s digital team responded to cyberattacks with a “cyber-blurring” strategy that involved fake email accounts loaded with false documents.
articles.abstract: Emmanuel Macron’s digital team responded to cyberattacks with a “cyber-blurring” strategy that involved fake email accounts loaded with false documents.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Everyone saw the hackers coming.
articles.byline: By Adam Nossiter, David E. Sanger and Nicole Perlroth

articles.headline: Sessions to Toughen Rules on Prosecuting Drug Crimes
articles.snippet: The policy change, expected soon, would be the attorney general’s most significant rollback of the Obama administration’s push for more flexible sentencing laws.
articles.abstract: The policy change, expected soon, would be the attorney general’s most significant rollback of the Obama administration’s push for more flexible sentencing laws.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Attorney General Jeff Sessions is expected to soon toughen rules on prosecuting drug crimes, according to people familiar with internal deliberations, in what would be a major rollback of Obama-era policies that would put his first big stamp on a Justice Department he has criticized as soft on crime.

articles.headline: Puerto Rico’s Debt Crisis Claims Another Casualty: Its Schools
articles.snippet: The secretary of education in Puerto Rico has pushed for closings and consolidations to save money. Teachers fear the cuts will cost them their jobs.
articles.abstract: The secretary of education in Puerto Rico has pushed for closings and consolidations to save money. Teachers fear the cuts will cost them their jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: AGUAS BUENAS, P.R. — Natalia Hernández stood before dawn with a bullhorn in her hand in front of the mountainside elementary school that four generations of her family attended, rattling off its academic accomplishments.

articles.headline: As Department Stores Close, Stitch Fix Expands Online
articles.snippet: The start-up had $730 million in sales last year and raised just $42 million, a relatively modest sum for a high-flying Silicon Valley start-up.
articles.abstract: The start-up had $730 million in sales last year and raised just $42 million, a relatively modest sum for a high-flying Silicon Valley start-up.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The retail landscape is littered with the casualties of changing consumer behavior. Shoppers are bargain hunting online, department stores are struggling, and once-mainstay brands are closing out permanently.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Katie Benner

articles.headline: Sense of Crisis Deepens as Trump Defends F.B.I. Firing
articles.snippet: President Trump shrugged off accusations of interference in the F.B.I.’s Russia inquiry, but several Republicans broke with their leadership to express concern.
articles.abstract: President Trump shrugged off accusations of interference in the F.B.I.’s Russia inquiry, but several Republicans broke with their leadership to express concern.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s abrupt dismissal of the F.B.I. director roiled Washington on Wednesday and deepened the sense of crisis swirling around the White House. Republican leaders came to the president’s defense, and Mr. Trump lashed out at Democrats and other critics, calling them hypocrites.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear, Jennifer Steinhauer and Matt Flegenheimer

articles.headline: Tech’s Frightful Five: They’ve Got Us
articles.snippet: Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, Facebook and Google dominate our day-to-day activities. Imagining being forced to give up some of them could lead to hard choices.
articles.abstract: Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, Facebook and Google dominate our day-to-day activities. Imagining being forced to give up some of them could lead to hard choices.
articles.lead_paragraph: A few weeks ago, I bought a new television. When the whole process was over, I realized something incredible: To navigate all of the niggling details surrounding this one commercial transaction — figuring out what to buy, which accessories I needed, how and where to install it, and whom to hire to do so — I had dealt with only a single ubiquitous corporation: Amazon.

articles.headline: Days Before Firing, Comey Asked for More Resources for Russia Inquiry
articles.snippet: James B. Comey made his appeal during a meeting last week with the deputy attorney general, who wrote the memo used to justify his firing.
articles.abstract: James B. Comey made his appeal during a meeting last week with the deputy attorney general, who wrote the memo used to justify his firing.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Days before he was fired as F.B.I. director, James B. Comey asked the Justice Department for more prosecutors and other personnel to accelerate the bureau’s investigation into Russia’s interference in the presidential election.
articles.byline: By Matthew Rosenberg and Matt Apuzzo
